clinical_study.brief_title: Autus Size-Adjustable Valve for Surgical Pulmonary Valve Replacement Early Feasibility Study
clinical_study.official_title: Autus Size-Adjustable Valve for Surgical Pulmonary Valve Replacement Early Feasibility Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Prospective, single-arm, multi-center study to evaluate safety and preliminary effectiveness of the Autus Size-Adjustable Valve in pediatric patients aged 2 to 10 years (± 6 months) requiring surgical pulmonary valve replacement. The Autus Valve may be expanded pre-implant to match the subject's body size. Subjects will be evaluated prior to the Autus Valve implant procedure, immediately post-implant, at hospital discharge, 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through 5 years.
The Autus Valve may be expanded post-implant via transcatheter balloon dilation to accommodate growth of the subject. In subjects who undergo a post-implant valve expansion, follow-up will continue for a minimum of 1 year after the post-implant valve expansion procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Post-implant Valve Expansion Primary Safety Endpoint

primary_outcome.description: Clinically acceptable hemodynamic performance at 12 months, defined as less than moderate pulmonary regurgitation, as assessed by the Echo Core Lab (ECL) via transthoracic echocardiogram (TTE).

primary_outcome.measure: Post-implant Valve Expansion Primary Effectiveness Endpoint

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Device-related
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Device-related complication post-valve implantation composite endpoint, including: death, valve thrombosis or thromboembolism (evaluation at 12 months is considered the valve implantation primary safety endpoint)

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Mortality
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Mortality, including: all cause, cardiac-related, procedure-related and device-related

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Thrombosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Thrombosis

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Thromboembolism
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Thromboembolism

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Reintervention
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Reintervention, including all-cause unplanned reintervention (surgical or transcatheter) and reoperation

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Major Hemorrhage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Major Hemorrhage

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Endocarditis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Endocarditis

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Hemolysis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Hemolysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Structural Valve Deterioration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Structural valve deterioration

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Valve/stent Frame Fracture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Valve/Stent Frame Fracture

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Device Explantation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Device explantation

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Safety Endpoint - Adverse Events (AE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation
secondary_outcome.description: The following secondary safety endpoint will be evaluated at 30 days, 6 and 12 months, and annually through a minimum of 5 years and up to 6 years post-valve implantation by an Independent CEC: • Adverse events (AE)

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Endpoint-Valve Implant Acute Procedural Success
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately Post-Valve Implant Procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Endpoint - Post-Implant Valve Expansion Acute Procedural Success
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after each post-implant valve expansion procedure
secondary_outcome.description: To meet the definition of success, at least one of the parameters listed below must be achieved after each post-implant valve expansion is performed, assessed during the same catheterization procedure: RV to aortic systolic pressure ratio: ≤0.5. Peak-to-peak RV to PA systolic pressure gradient: ≤15 mmHg; Peak-to-peak RV to PA systolic pressure gradient: ≥50% reduction (pre vs post valve expansion).

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Endpoint - Change in Cardiac Index Post-Implant Valve Expansion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after each post-implant valve expansion procedure
secondary_outcome.description: The percent change in cardiac index (pre- versus post-valve dilation) will be determined for each post-implant valve expansion performed using the Direct Fick Method of measuring Cardiac Output.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Echo-Related Endpoint - Pulmonary Regurgitation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through 5 years post-valve implant and 30 days, 6 months, and 12 months post-valve expansion.
secondary_outcome.description: Pulmonary regurgitation status categorized as none/trivial, mild, moderate, severe as evaluated by the Echo Core Laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Echo-Related Endpoint - Freedom from Moderate or Greater Pulmonary Regurgitation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through 5 years post-valve implant and 30 days, 6 months, and 12 months post-valve expansion.
secondary_outcome.description: Freedom from moderate or greater pulmonary regurgitation, as evaluated by the Echo Core Laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Echo-Related Endpoint - Pulmonary Stenosis Status
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through 5 years post-valve implant and 30 days, 6 months, and 12 months post-valve expansion.
secondary_outcome.description: Pulmonary stenosis status categorized as none/trivial, mild, moderate, severe, as evaluated by the Echo Core Laboratory.

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Echo-Related Endpoint - RV to PA systolic pressure gradient - multi-level assessment via Pulsed Wave (PW) Doppler
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through 5 years post-valve implant and 30 days, 6 months, and 12 months post-valve expansion.
secondary_outcome.description: RV to PA systolic pressure gradient assessed via Continuous Wave (CW) Doppler (peak and mean instantaneous gradient);

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Echo-Related Endpoint - RV to PA systolic pressure gradient - multi-level assessment via Continuous Wave (CW) Doppler
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through 5 years post-valve implant and 30 days, 6 months, and 12 months post-valve expansion.
secondary_outcome.description: RV to PA systolic pressure gradient - multi-level (subvalvar, valvar, supravalvar) assessment via Pulsed Wave (PW) Doppler (peak and mean instantaneous gradient);

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Echo-Related Endpoint - Paravalvular Leak
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through 5 years post-valve implant and 30 days, 6 months, and 12 months post-valve expansion.
secondary_outcome.description: Paravalvular Leak

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Echo-Related Endpoint - Right Ventricular Measures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through 5 years post-valve implant and 30 days, 6 months, and 12 months post-valve expansion.
secondary_outcome.description: Right ventricular measures, including mass, volume, pressure and function

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Echo-Related Endpoint - Left Ventricular Measures
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through 5 years post-valve implant and 30 days, 6 months, and 12 months post-valve expansion.
secondary_outcome.description: Left ventricular measures, including mass, volume, and function

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Endpoint - Valve/Stent Fracture
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Annually through 5 years post-valve implant and 12 months post-valve expansion.
secondary_outcome.description: Valve/stent fracture will be assessed by an Independent Medical Reviewer via chest x-ray

secondary_outcome.measure: Secondary Effectiveness Endpoint - Modified Ross Functional Classification
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 6 months, 12 months, and annually through 5 years post-valve implant and 30 days, 6 months, and 12 months post-valve expansion.
secondary_outcome.description: Modified Ross Functional Class as assessed by the Site Investigators

arm_group.description: Pulmonary Valve Replacement Surgery with the Autus Valve

intervention.description: Pulmonary valve replacement surgery with the Autus Valve

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Candidates must meet all of the following inclusion criteria to be considered for enrollment in this study.
1. Age 2 to 10 years old (± 6 months).
2. Male or female.
3. Subject has a native or repaired right ventricular outflow tract.
4. Subject has been recommended for surgical pulmonary valve replacement by treating clinical team (cardiologist and cardiac surgeon).
5. Subject has at least one of the following echocardiographic findings:
1. Severe pulmonary stenosis (defined as RV to PA peak instantaneous gradient ≥60 mmHg);
2. Moderate or greater pulmonary regurgitation (defined as (vena contracta jet width/square root of BSA) ≥2.98 mm/m2).
3. Moderate or greater pulmonary stenosis plus moderate or greater pulmonary regurgitation.
6. Subject's body size is suitable for implantation of a study device ranging from 12.7 to 22 mm (internal diameter).
7. Subject's pulmonary artery length (measured from pulmonary valve annulus to pulmonary artery bifurcation) is at least 25 mm.
8. Subject and parent/legal representative, where appropriate, are willing to provide informed written consent.
9. Subject and parent/legal representative, where appropriate, and treating physician agree that the subject will return for, and comply with, all required study assessments and follow-up visits.
Exclusion Criteria:
Candidates will be excluded from the study if any of the following conditions are met:
1. Subject requires valve replacement in a non-pulmonary position.
2. Subject has a prosthetic valve at other valve position or will need a prosthetic valve at other valve position (i.e., anticipation for additional valve replacements needed within 3 years).
3. Subject has pulmonary arterial hypertension (defined as mean PA pressure ≥25 mmHg).
4. Subject has pulmonary atresia and major aortopulmonary collaterals.
5. Subject has significant peripheral pulmonary artery stenosis.
6. Subject requires a concomitant non-cardiac surgical procedure.
7. Subject has an active infection requiring current antibiotic therapy (if temporary illness, subject may be a candidate 4 weeks after discontinuation of antibiotics).
8. Subject has active endocarditis or a history of infective endocarditis.
9. Subject has renal insufficiency as determined by a serum creatinine (S-Cr) level ≥2.5 mg/dL within 60 days prior to the Screening Visit, or has end-stage renal disease.
10. Subject has leukopenia (defined as a white blood cell (WBC) count <3.5 x 103/µL)
11. Subject has acute or chronic anemia (defined as hemoglobin (Hgb) <10.0 g/dl or 6 mmol/L).
12. Subject has thrombocytopenia (defined as platelet count <50 x 103/µL.
13. Subject has known a hypersensitivity to anticoagulants and antiplatelet drugs.
14. Subject has a known autoimmune disease or receives immunosuppressant and/or immunostimulant drugs.
15. Subject needs emergency cardiac or vascular surgery or intervention.
16. Subject has, in the opinion of the Investigator, a life expectancy of less than 5 years.
17. Subject or parent/legal representative refuses blood transfusions.
18. Subject has medical, social or psychosocial factors that, in the opinion of the Investigator, could impact safety or compliance with study procedures.
19. Subject is participating in an investigational study of a new drug, biologic or device at the time of study screening.

facility.name: Columbia University Irving Medical Center/New York Presbyterian Morgan Stanley Children's Hospital
